entries.title: The Ukrainians Stuck in Russia’s New Gulag
entries.snippet: Even if a peace can be reached, it won’t be easy to solve the problem of Ukrainian civilians languishing in Russian jails. This is one prisoner’s story.

entries.title: Israeli Hostage Recounts Beatings and Starvation During Hamas Captivity
entries.snippet: Segev Kalfon said he endured physical abuse and mind games during 738 days in the hands of Hamas. Now, he asks why it took so long for Israel to bring him home.

entries.title: In Firing His No. 2, Zelensky Loses Both a Negotiator and an Enforcer
entries.snippet: Andriy Yermak had ensured internal discipline in Ukraine’s wartime politics. He also led the country’s peace negotiations, which now must go on without him.

entries.title: Latin American Leaders Face Both Trump and Voters Deported by the U.S.
entries.snippet: The upcoming election in Honduras shows how politicians must balance cooperation with the Trump administration with their obligation to undocumented citizens in the United States who may be deported.

entries.title: Did Pope Leo Pray in Istanbul’s Blue Mosque? Not Visibly, at Least.
entries.snippet: Leo XIV is being closely watched on an inaugural trip to Turkey and Lebanon to spread a message of peace and outreach.

entries.title: Syria Tiptoes Toward Transitional Justice One Year After Assad’s Ouster
entries.snippet: Fourteen people are on trial, charged with crimes related to an outbreak of sectarian violence under the new government. The abuses of the old Assad regime still await a reckoning.

entries.title: Russia Bombards Ukraine for Nearly 10 Hours in a Deadly Assault
entries.snippet: The attack came as U.S. officials were expected to hold peace talks with Ukrainian and Russian officials in the coming days.

entries.title: Pope Leo to Visit Turkey and Lebanon
entries.snippet: On his last day in Turkey, Leo XIV visited Istanbul’s Blue Mosque where, unlike his two most recent predecessors, he did not visibly pray. The pope heads to Lebanon on Sunday.

entries.title: Deadly Hong Kong Fire Is a Test of Beijing’s Rule in the City
entries.snippet: After Beijing reshaped the political order in Hong Kong in its image, the fire has become a test of how well that new system can govern in a crisis.

entries.title: Where Hundreds of Undocumented Migrants Have Died in Custody
entries.snippet: Malaysia launched a “year of enforcement” in response to a surge in undocumented migrants, many of them from Myanmar. Some faced nightmarish fates.

entries.title: South Africans Were Promised Job, but Ended Up ‘Going to War’ for Russia
entries.snippet: The South African government is investigating how more than a dozen men unwittingly ended up on the front line in Russia’s war on Ukraine.

entries.title: As Cyclone Deaths Pass 150, Sri Lanka Is Overwhelmed by Rescue Demand
entries.snippet: Rescue efforts across the nation of 23 million have been hampered by disruptions in transport and telecommunications.

entries.title: Andriy Yermak Resigns: What to Know About Ukrainian Official
entries.snippet: The chief of staff to President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine was seen as the second-most powerful person in Ukraine. He was dismissed on Friday.

entries.title: Rebel Nuns Can Live in Old Abbey, if They Give Up Social Media
entries.snippet: After the octogenarian nuns refused to return to their senior center, the abbot has finally folded. But he has some conditions.

entries.title: Highlight Reel
entries.snippet: As the year comes to a close, we want to know your highly specific, idiosyncratic bests of 2025.

entries.title: Fresh Reporting on Asylum Seekers at the U.S.-Canadian Border
entries.snippet: Canada has made its border with the United States tougher to cross. Here’s what we learned through monthlong reporting on a single case.

entries.title: Trump to Pardon Juan Orlando Hernández, Honduran Ex-Leader Convicted in Drug Case
entries.snippet: Juan Orlando Hernández was accused of receiving millions in bribes and partnering with cocaine traffickers. He was convicted in Manhattan in 2024 and sentenced to 45 years in prison.

entries.title: Trump Spoke by Phone Last Week With Maduro, Venezuela’s Leader
entries.snippet: They discussed a possible meeting between the two of them, but nothing has been scheduled, and the administration continues to increase the military pressure on Venezuela.

entries.title: Parts of Southern Ontario Pummeled by Snow Squalls and Heavy Winds
entries.snippet: More localized bands of squalls were expected to form, with up to two feet of snow possible in some areas, according to Canada’s forecast agency.

entries.title: Trump’s Response to Shooting Shows Intensified Anti-Migrant Stance
entries.snippet: The president is furiously demanding limits on migration and attacking ethnic groups as he steps up his efforts to equate immigration with crime and economic distress.

entries.title: A Hong Kong Fire Survivor’s Escape, in His Own Words
entries.snippet: In his own words, William Li, a resident of the Hong Kong apartment complex that became an inferno, recounted how he and two neighbors survived until help arrived.

entries.title: Officials Had Been Warned for Over a Year Before Hong Kong Fire
entries.snippet: Residents of Wang Fuk Court apartments had raised concerns about flammable foam panels and scaffold netting, but the government did not take decisive action.

entries.title: Andriy Yermak, Zelensky’s Chief of Staff, Resigns
entries.snippet: Andriy Yermak, President Volodymyr Zelensky’s chief of staff and top peace negotiator, became the highest-ranking casualty of an investigation into a vast kickback scheme.

entries.title: Israeli Raid in Southern Syria Kills at Least 13, Syrian Officials Say
entries.snippet: The raid was one of Israel’s deadliest cross-border incursions since Bashar al-Assad, Syria’s former dictator, was ousted last year.

entries.title: Israeli Forces Kill Two Palestinians in West Bank After They Appear to Surrender, Video Shows
entries.snippet: The Israeli authorities said they were investigating the shooting, which came amid days of extensive military operations in the West Bank.

entries.title: Worker Cleared of Stealing Snacks From Office Fridge After 2 Years in Court
entries.snippet: A South Korean man accused of stealing a Choco Pie and a mini custard cake was acquitted after a prosecution that drew widespread criticism.

entries.title: Aftershocks of an Art Crime Reverberate in Japan
entries.snippet: At least four works by a famous convicted forger have been discovered in Japan. Transparency about the mistakes, however, has sparked as much curiosity as scandal.

entries.title: Hondurans Fear Unrest Ahead of Election as Trump Endorses a Candidate
entries.snippet: On Sunday, voters will choose between a left-wing presidential candidate and two conservatives, one backed by President Trump. The results are likely to be bitterly contested.

entries.title: Home of Ukraine’s Lead Negotiator Is Searched in Corruption Case
entries.snippet: The scrutiny of Andriy Yermak, President Volodymyr Zelensky’s chief of staff, could disrupt U.S.-led peace talks and further rattle Ukrainian politics.

entries.title: Death Toll Rises to 128 in Hong Kong High-Rise Fire
entries.snippet: Hope of finding survivors has dwindled, with many residents of the Wang Fuk Court towers still unaccounted for. Eight more people were arrested Friday over the blaze.

entries.title: Sri Lanka Battered by Cyclone as Death Toll Climbs to 69
entries.snippet: Torrential downpours and high winds struck large parts of the island nation as Cyclone Ditwah churned northwest toward India.

entries.title: In Turkey, Pope Seeks to Soothe an Ancient Christian Divide
entries.snippet: In Istanbul, Pope Leo XIV will meet the patriarch of the Eastern Orthodox Church to show amity between two of the world’s largest Christian groups.

entries.title: Did Myanmar’s Junta Demolish Scam Centers Just for Show?
entries.snippet: Myanmar’s junta made a grand display of demolishing buildings that hosted the centers, even broadcasting the explosions. But the scammers have found new homes.

entries.title: Carney Lifts Climate Laws for New Alberta Pipeline
entries.snippet: Prime Minister Mark Carney reached a tentative deal with the province as part of his program to curb the country’s economic dependence on the United States.

entries.title: Louvre Raising Ticket Prices for Non-European Visitors
entries.snippet: From Jan. 14, visitors to the museum from outside the European Economic Area will pay 45 percent more for entry to help finance its ambitious renovation plan.

entries.title: A.I. and the Trillion-Dollar Question
entries.snippet: Even the companies building the technology don’t seem exactly sure where it’s headed.

entries.title: Why Is the U.S. Threatening Venezuela?
entries.snippet: Venezuela doesn’t play a large role in the drug trade to the United States, so what is motivating the massive military buildup? Julian E. Barnes, who reports on intelligence and international security, discusses the issues with our senior writer Katrin Bennhold.

entries.title: What to Know About the Coup in Guinea-Bissau
entries.snippet: The opposition has accused the president of putting a general in charge of the government so that he could stay in power and lead by proxy.

entries.title: Putin Defends Witkoff Against Accusations of Pro-Russia Bias
entries.snippet: The Russian leader called the U.S. special envoy “an intelligent man” who is properly representing his country in peace negotiations.

entries.title: Russia Labels Navalny’s Anti-Corruption Group as Terrorist Organization
entries.snippet: A legal assault against the opposition leader’s movement has deepened since his death in prison last year.

entries.title: Rocket Attack on Iraqi Gas Field Cuts Power to Most of Kurdistan
entries.snippet: The strike is the latest in a string of attacks on energy infrastructure in Iraq’s northern Kurdish region, which some regional authorities have privately blamed on Iran-affiliated militias.

entries.title: France Creates Voluntary Military Service as Europe Faces Russian Threat
entries.snippet: The effort, aimed at young people, came after an army chief angered many by saying the country must accept the possible loss of “our children” in a future war.

entries.title: The British Public Thinks Immigration Is Up. It’s Actually Down, Sharply.
entries.snippet: Net migration to Britain has fallen by almost 80 percent from its 2023 peak, according to data released on Thursday.

entries.title: Images From the Deadly High-Rise Fire in Hong Kong
entries.snippet: The blaze tore through an apartment complex, killing scores. Dozens more are believed to be missing in what remains of the buildings.

entries.title: Pope Leo Visits Turkey on His First Trip as Pontiff
entries.snippet: The pope started his six-day trip, which will also include a visit to Lebanon.

entries.title: Hong Kongers Volunteer to Help Fire Victims
entries.snippet: Residents from across the city have quickly organized to donate food, water, clothing and other supplies in Tai Po for the many displaced people.

entries.title: Hong Kong’s Worst Fire in Decades Fuels Scrutiny of Safety Lapses
entries.snippet: The authorities said flammable netting and foam boards may have fueled the city’s deadliest blaze in nearly 80 years, killing more than 90 and prompting arrests.

entries.title: ‘No Alarm Went Off’: Hong Kong Fire Survivor Recounts Harrowing Escape
entries.snippet: Many windows were covered, preventing residents from seeing the fire and smoke, one survivor said.

entries.title: Trump Cut Europe Out of Ukraine Talks. Here’s How Europe Pushed Back.
entries.snippet: European leaders were blindsided by President Trump’s 28-point-plan to end the Ukraine war, setting off a dash for influence.

entries.title: Pope Leo Lands in Turkey, Planning to Meet Erdogan With a Message of Outreach
entries.snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan received Leo XIV on the opening leg of a trip that will also include Lebanon.

entries.title: Here’s the latest.
Heading to the Mideast, Pope Leo May Show ‘Who He Really Is’
entries.snippet: The pontiff begins a trip to Turkey and Lebanon on Thursday — the first foreign voyage of his papacy, and his biggest test yet.

entries.title: Hong Kong Arrests 3 Tied to Construction Company After Deadly Apartment Fire
entries.snippet: The police said that building materials used by the company for the work at Wang Fuk Court may not have been up to fire safety standards. The police did not identify the company or who was arrested.

entries.title: U.S. to Press Europe and Other Allies on Immigration, Document Says
entries.snippet: American diplomats were told to raise U.S. concerns about “violent crimes associated with people of a migration background.”

entries.title: Trump Says South Africa Is Not Invited to G20 Summit in U.S. in 2026
entries.snippet: The president did not attend this year’s annual gathering in South Africa, which has been a frequent target of his attacks.

entries.title: As Trade Talks Stall, Carney Moves to Shield Canada from Trump Tariffs
entries.snippet: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced curbs on steel imports, a new tariff and help with steel and lumber freight costs in a bid to aid Canadian industries.

entries.title: E.P.A. Delays Requirements to Cut Methane, a Potent Greenhouse Gas
entries.snippet: Oil and gas firms were supposed to start reducing methane, a powerful driver of climate change. The agency is giving them more time and may cancel the requirement.

entries.title: Top U.S. Negotiator Warned Europeans That Russia Is Stockpiling Missiles
entries.snippet: Daniel P. Driscoll, the U.S. Army secretary, used the growing threat from Moscow as a way to sell a quick peace deal unfavorable to Ukraine.

entries.title: No, you can’t get your AI to ‘admit’ to being sexist, but it probably is
entries.snippet: Though LLMs might not use explicitly biased language, they may infer your demographic data and display implicit biases, researchers say.

entries.title: VC Kara Nortman bet early on women’s sports, and now she’s creating the market
entries.snippet: As women's sports enters what feels like a sustained boom period -- the Golden State Valkyries just played their first WNBA next season, the NWSL is expanding, media rights deals are growing -- Nortman remains cautiously optimistic about whether this moment will prove different from past surges in interest.

entries.title: Supabase hit $5B by turning down million-dollar contracts. Here’s why.
entries.snippet: Vibe coding has taken the tech industry by storm, and it’s not just the Lovables and Replits of the world that are winning. The startups building the infrastructure behind them are cashing in too.  Supabase, the open-source database platform that’s become the backend of choice for the vibe-coding world, raised $100 million at a $5 billion valuation just months after closing $200 million at $2 billion. But co-founder and CEO […]

entries.title: SoftBank stays in as Meesho $606M IPO becomes India’s first major e-commerce listing
entries.snippet: Meesho heads for India's first big e-commerce IPO next week.

entries.title: How OpenAI and Google see AI changing go-to-market strategies
entries.snippet: AI is changing how investors and startups bring their products to market. Three experts offered their insights at TechCrunch Disrupt.

entries.title: The race to regulate AI has sparked a federal vs state showdown
entries.snippet: The fight over AI regulation isn't about the technology -- it's about whether Washington or the states get to set the rules, and what happens to consumers caught in between.

entries.title: Best iPad apps to boost productivity and make your life easier
entries.snippet: There are many iPad apps to help you organize recipes; sync tasks across devices; be more productive; and manage your notes.

entries.snippet: Defense tech startup Anduril Industries has faced numerous setbacks during testing of its autonomous weapons systems, according to new reporting by the WSJ.

entries.title: The future will be explained to you in Palo Alto

This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous. The series has traveled around the globe under the auspices of TechCrunch. Steve Case rented a […]

entries.title: Nordic founders are taking bigger swings, and it’s paying off
entries.snippet: Ten years ago, raising €1 million in Copenhagen was enough to make waves in the region’s tech scene. Today, the Nordics are turning out billion-dollar companies like Lovable — which hit $200 million in revenue just 12 months after launching.  Dennis Green-Lieber, founder of AI-powered customer intelligence platform Propane, has had a front-row seat to that shift […]

entries.title: JustiGuide wants to use AI to help people navigate the US immigration system
entries.snippet: The startup uses AI to help immigrants understand the system, connect with lawyers, and reduce associated costs.

entries.title: OpenAI claims teen circumvented safety features before suicide that ChatGPT helped plan
entries.snippet: In August, parents Matthew and Maria Raine sued OpenAI and its CEO, Sam Altman, over their 16-year-old son Adam's suicide, accusing the company of wrongful death. On Tuesday, OpenAI responded to the lawsuit with a filing of its own, arguing that it shouldn't be held responsible for the teenager's death.

entries.title: Redwood Materials reportedly cuts 5% of staff after $350M raise
entries.snippet: The battery recycling and cathode production company, founded by former Tesla CTO JB Straubel, has started using recycled battery materials to create energy storage solutions for AI data centers.

entries.snippet: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

entries.title: Multiple London councils report disruption amid ongoing cyberattack
entries.snippet: Three London councils reported disruption, prompting officials to shut down phone lines and networks and activate emergency plans.

entries.snippet: A widening corruption scandal forced Ukraine's second most powerful person, Andriy Yermak, to resign.

entries.snippet: The three nuns say they were taken out of the convent against their will and placed in a care home.

entries.snippet: At least 80 people have died in Indonesia with another 56 dead in Sri Lanka in a week of extreme weather.
